Posts.EditableText: mp3 should work fine with the windows Quest editor (which apparently uses chrome as its browser). Be aware that when published only chrome, IE and Safari support mp3 files though. To play a sound you run a script and choose 'play sound' which then gives you the option to browse your hard drive for the audio file you want. This can all be done in the UI. You can select it to loop or be a one shot. I'm not sure that you're doing the right thing if you're trying to do it using a function. It probably can be done that way - I've never tried - but the simplest method is through running a script when you want the sound to be played. This is the tutorial on running scripts although I'm sure you already know this. http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/ ... ripts.html

[quote="Tensin":1hw341nk]That works for playing a single sound, but I'm trying to play back ground music throughout the entire game.[/quote:1hw341nk]

In what way? You can loop a sound. So you can be in the lobby and play a sound on loop then move to the lounge and play a different sound on loop etc. sound can mean music or whatever.

If you want to play an entire soundtrack from start to finish regardless of the game state then that's a different question. You would need to create one entire file of the whole soundtrack and play that. Unfortunately I think Quest has file size limits but that should only really apply to the online not offline version. 

You're going to have to be more specific in your question as I'm still unsure of what you actually want.
